intro: Hesperis punctata, commonly known as the purple rockcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and clusters of bright purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its flowers are typically four-petaled and have a distinctive appearance, often with a yellow center. Hesperis punctata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
